Alter the outcome of the American Civil War, which ended roughly 150 years ago. This conflict had far-reaching repercussions, including the abolition of slavery, the reunification of the states, and the rise of the United States as a major power. Changing the outcome could have had a major impact on the course of American and world history.

Change the events leading up to the sinking of the Titanic. This tragedy claimed the lives of over 1,500 passengers and crew members. By altering the circumstances surrounding the ship's collision with the iceberg, we might have saved countless lives.

Modify the course of World War I, which marked the end of the Ottoman Empire and led to the rise of new world powers, including the United States and the Soviet Union. Altering the conflict could have had a profound impact on global politics and history.

Alter the outcome of the Battle of Waterloo in 1815, which led to Napoleon's defeat and the end of his empire. By changing the outcome, we might have seen a vastly different political landscape in Europe.

Change the outcome of the sinking of the Titanic, which had a significant impact on maritime safety regulations and the film industry. This alteration could have led to changes in safety regulations and the direction of the film industry.
